publicwhip.major-heading: Construction Industry Training Board: Annual Report

speech.p: My honourable friend the Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State for Northern Ireland (Maria Eagle) has made the following Ministerial Statement.
I am pleased to announce the publication of the Construction Industry Training Board annual report and accounts for the 2004–05 financial year. This document is now available in the Library.

publicwhip.major-heading: Department for Work and Pensions: Departmental Report

speech.p: My right honourable friend the Secretary of State for Work and Pensions (John Hutton) has made the following Written Ministerial Statement.

I am today able to announce the publication of the Department for Work and Pensions departmental report. The report provides details of the department's performance in 2005–06 against its public service agreement targets and sets out the department's expenditure plans for 2006–07 to 2007–08. Copies have been placed in the Library.
My right honourable friend the Secretary of State for Health (Patricia Hewitt) has made the following Written Ministerial Statement.
I am today laying before Parliament the Department of Health's annual report for 2006 (Cm 6814).
Copies have been placed in the Library.

The Government are grateful to the Intelligence and Security Committee for its Report into the London Terrorist Attacks on 7 July 2005 (Cm 6785). Following consultation with the committee over matters that could not be published without prejudicing the work of the intelligence and security agencies, as well as on matters which are sub judice, my right honourable friend the Prime Minister has today laid the report before the House.
My right honourable friend the Prime Minister has also laid before the House today the Government's response to this report (Cm 6786).
Copies of the report and the response have been placed in the Libraries of both Houses.
My right honourable friend the Secretary of State for Northern Ireland (Peter Hain) has made the following Ministerial Statement.

In addition to my appointment of Eileen Bell MLA (Alliance) as Presiding Officer to the Assembly under Paragraph 3(1)(a) of Schedule 1 to the Northern Ireland Act 2006, I have today appointed Jim Wells MLA (DUP) and Francie Molloy MLA (Sinn Fein) as Deputy Presiding Officers to the Assembly under the same legislation.
I have also placed copies of Assembly Standing Orders determined under Paragraph 4 (1) of Schedule 1 to the Northern Ireland Act 2006 in the Libraries of both Houses.
